Bruce Wayne.Action: Screams from incomprehensible horror in nightmare, showing deep emotional turmoil and vulnerability.
Wakes up disoriented and splashes cold water on his face, internally struggling with fear and doubt.
Wakes up from a nightmare in distress, trembling and unsure about what to do next.
Immediately attempts to ground himself by splashing cold water on his face after waking disoriented.
Carries heavy car parts alone and says little to Little Al despite friendly interaction.
Nods in response to Little Al's questions, does not initiate conversation or show openness.
Rejects offer of help from Little Al with a curt 'I'm fine.'
Maintains tired, troubled eyes and minimal engagement despite friendly concern from Little Al.
Loads heavy car parts onto a truck and manages multiple repair orders, indicating physical capability and task management.
Silent, troubled, tired demeanor and pale skin suggest physical and possibly mental exhaustion affecting performance.
Maintains control over repair orders and job responsibilities, showing awareness and organization.
Dismisses offer of help despite appearing unwell, possibly indicative of poor self-care or overconfidence in own capacity.
Rejects Little Al's friendly advice and emotional concern, refuses to open up about his nightmares or struggles.
Closes the curtains when Selina waves playfully, avoiding interaction.
Writes a sincere, confused letter to his father expressing emotional vulnerability and desire for understanding.
Avoids engaging with Little Al's advice and denies his own struggles; remains isolated and silent about his nightmares.
Closes the blackout curtains when noticing Selina across the street, indicating control over his environment and discretion.
Writes a letter to his deceased father asking for understanding, showing introspection but also uncertainty and confusion.
Stares quietly at the wooden box given by Little Al, showing hesitation and introspection.
Writes a letter to his deceased father expressing vulnerability and need for guidance.
Stares silently at the wooden box containing his inheritance, wrestling internally with his emotions and readiness.
Writes a letter expressing his doubts and fear of losing control, seeking guidance.
Flinches and experiences torment and rage upon reliving traumatic childhood memories, shows physical signs of distress like shaking hands.
Crosses the street and follows a drunken detective into a dangerous cathouse to potentially intervene or investigate cautiously.
Stops at the first step instead of rushing in during the altercation upstairs, showing caution and awareness of the situation.
Appears suddenly and silently in a room where a woman is being violently attacked, showing unholy rage to intervene.
Appears suddenly at a critical moment, showing readiness and control under pressure.
Does not verbally engage or negotiate immediately in a violent confrontation, relying on presence and intimidation.
Makes a desperate play by throwing himself out the window to escape detection and pursuit, demonstrating quick thinking and physical capability.
Hangs by his fingers four stories up but ultimately cannot regain footing and falls, failing to secure a safe escape despite initial skill.
Works obsessively and physically strains himself, pushing his limits without rest.
Paces nervously, unable to focus or write a coherent letter, expresses fear he may have killed a man, indicating inner turmoil and lack of emotional control.
Throws the wooden box violently against the wall, damaging his own equipment and causing a power outage while expressing fear and frustration.
Flinches at the sound of the gunshot, showing a moment of fear or surprise but no immediate action.
Is entranced by the events unfolding on TV, showing passive observation rather than intervention or analysis.
Watches Gordon's declaration of war on crime with intense focus and emotional reaction, showing sincere engagement with Gotham's suffering.
Expresses gratitude to his late father and commits to action, indicating a sense of responsibility to help others.
No direct interaction or expression of warmth towards others in this excerpt; focused inwardly on his mission.
Waits in a doorway to gather information, begins investigative trail focused on finding Selina, approaches informant directly despite hostility.
Passively receives insult and does not immediately react aggressively or retreat; instead, persists in inquiry.
Applies a fake scar carefully to disguise himself and adopts a concealment outfit, showing planning and attention to detail before venturing out.
Walks into a dangerous area knowingly and silently observes the muggers to understand the environment before acting.
Remains silent and does not respond to the muggersâ€™ provocation, indicating restraint and measured behavior.
Cracks a gentle smile before confrontation.
Responds to aggression with brutal, violent retaliation against muggers.
Offers a final kick and walks off after fighting muggers, showing no mercy.
Intervenes against skinheads assaulting a beaten woman, fights them with intense joy.
Assaults a drug dealer violently, showing no patience or tolerance.
Smiles comfortedly while sleeping, indicating some inner peace or positive emotion.
Warns thugs to leave because it isn't safe.
Uses violent tactics (fire) against the thugs without showing mercy.
Writes a sincere and reflective letter to his father expressing vulnerability and a desire to improve.
Reads a recipe from the Anarchist's Handbook, makes a tar-like substance, sets an explosive, and smiles at the destruction.
Enters a chop-shop confidently, using a disguise and sports gear, asserts control by ordering thieves to put on handcuffs, demonstrating strategic planning and calculated risk-taking.
Sustains serious injuries while fighting criminals, stitches his own wounds, continues his mission relentlessly.
Uses violent chemical means (white phosphorus) to incapacitate criminals without lethal intent, allowing them to vomit and escape.
Moves quickly and skillfully across rooftops, showing physical agility and stealth.
Adopts a new identity that gives him an edge and allows him to work at night effectively.
Focuses on transforming his methods and disguise, adapting to challenges.

Throws a vicious kick to disarm a gunner before he can fire, skillfully engages multiple armed foes with precise and effective combat moves, demonstrates strategic knowledge of defenses and control of the fight.
Despite the tough fight and losing his cape, maintains focus and grows stronger, showing mental resilience and tactical confidence.
Drugs and publicly humiliates Estrada to extract information, showing ruthless tactics.
Interrogates Estrada personally using a dangerous but effective method (hydro-strychnine-sulfate) to extract information.
Displays tactical awareness by targeting the key figure (Estrada) and orchestrating a public exposure of his criminal activities.
Listens carefully to the taped confession of Estrada to gather evidence against corruption.
Remains in his damaged Bat-suit, bloodied and bruised, showing physical and mental endurance despite setbacks.
Sits in his car covertly surveilling the police station, indicating strategic patience and planning.
Does not intervene directly when Estrada is released despite knowing about corruption and threats.
Hears criminal plans and decides not to trigger the grenade impulsively, showing restraint and awareness of unknown factors.
Drives at high speed with crude home-made night-vision goggles, evades multiple pursuers by swerving abruptly off the road to hide in the woods, listens and responds quickly to radio transmissions.
Cuffs Selina to the dashboard unexpectedly, showing quick decisive action though risks antagonizing an ally.
Tracks Selina through the woods, anticipates her moves, tackles and pins her down despite her agility and claws.
Confronts Selina with clear knowledge of the crime, maintains control in a tense situation, shows moral clarity in refusing to let murder go unpunished.
Fails to immediately identify the true killer, shows some initial uncertainty when Selina denies responsibility.
Expresses concern and helps Selina by fighting off attacker and giving her tools to take care of herself.
Teasingly interacts with Selina, showing familiarity and lightheartedness.
Focused intently on crime-fighting preparation, showing dedication but no social warmth in this moment.
Slaps gun out of Gordon's hands to prevent escalation, tries to explain himself, warns Gordon not to shoot.
Physically attacks Gordon and causes chaos despite attempts to avoid violence.
Surprises Gordon by appearing suddenly and offers help.
Slaps gun out of Gordon's hand, showing quick reflexes.
Tries to detain Gordon but fumbles with his jacket in a tense moment.
Throws Gordon through several cops, successfully creating a diversion.
Escapes despite being shot and surrounded, showing resilience and tactical retreat.
Survives a firebomb explosion by quickly throwing himself clear, then injects a stimulant to counteract injury and fatigue.
Assesses the danger of a steel door bearing a high-voltage warning and decides to pick the lock relying on his judgment of the sign's truthfulness.
Keeps grim determination and moves through a burning, collapsing building despite heavy injury and danger.
Throws knife accurately to incapacitate a SWAT team member.
Uses the environment and resources (exploding plumbing) to create a distraction and evade capture.
Shows ability to escape through narrow, unpleasant spaces (toilet hole) despite injury (limping).
Recovers to the Batcave with extensive damage showing the severity of the encounter but maintains operational status of equipment and vehicle.
Blocks the SUV exit on his motorcycle, vaults over the hood instead of getting out of the way, attacks the driver aggressively and skillfully.
Protects Ann by using himself as a human shield against Loeb's gun, risking his own life.
Despite severe injury, attempts to rise and continue the confrontation, showing resilience and determination.
His mask is gone and disguise shredded, yet he still manages to coordinate with Gordon and face an armed opponent, demonstrating adaptability under pressure.
Uses a throwing knife as a defensive weapon when out of conventional options, showing resourcefulness and tactical thinking.
Stumbles and rises very unsteadily, indicating physical vulnerability or compromised condition impacting performance.
Steadies Gordon when he staggers, despite being injured himself
Protects Ann by telling Gordon not to shoot because she is too close
Inflicts severe injury on Loeb without hesitation
Reflects on his father's teachings with gratitude and burns old letters to find his own path.
Reflects thoughtfully on his father's teachings and consciously decides to forge his own path, symbolically burning old letters.
Allows a mysterious intruder to enter the penthouse and remove a valuable painting unnoticed (implied omission).
Returns to Gotham after pursuing education at the finest schools in Europe.
Wipes away a tear after signing a letter as Batman, showing emotional vulnerability.
Stands close to Chi-Chi with pure unholy hatred when he sees him abusing Selina.
Moves to take out Chi-Chi despite the danger after Selina is backhanded.
Obeys Selina's silent command to let it go and walks away.
Signs a letter pleading for help to his father, showing vulnerability and openness.
Quietly stares at the wooden box instead of sleeping, indicating introspection but emotional distance.
Signs and sends a letter asking for help and instructions regarding his inheritance, then prepares for bed but cannot sleep, instead staring at the wooden box.
Flinches and shows torment during dream recalling parents' murder, expresses rage and suffering.
Crosses the street and follows Detective Campbell into the cathouse, cautiously entering to presumably intervene in a hostile situation.
Delivers multiple, severe physical attacks to Campbell, resulting in Campbell's death.
Staggers when hit by Selina, indicating surprise rather than aggression toward her.
Attempts to escape the police quietly and without resistance after the violent encounter.
Delivers multiple effective blows to incapacitate Campbell quickly and decisively.
Fails to anticipate Selina's intervention and is hit unexpectedly, causing him to stagger.
Attempts to escape through a bathroom window but misjudges its size and cannot get out.
Remains conscious enough to hold his head and look for an escape route despite pain and confusion.
Makes a desperate attempt to escape to avoid confrontation, risking falling from a window rather than engaging directly.
Climbs out from under the filth in the air-shaft and pushes open a basement window after falling.
Tries to look inconspicuous on the sidewalk at a crime scene with hands in pockets and head down.
Crashes into rubbish after slipping and falling from a height.
Works obsessively and refuses to acknowledge concern from Little Al about his health and rest.
Feels deep guilt and fear after possibly killing a man, showing internal struggle and remorse.
Is isolated and unable to calm himself, pacing nervously and struggling to write a letter.
Observes Gordon's public declaration against crime carefully and thoughtfully, indicating active mental engagement.
Reacts strongly to the revelation with urgency, searching for and retrieving the wooden box containing his father's signet ring.
Symbolically puts on his father's ring and screams into the storm, expressing resolve and clarity of purpose.
Waits in a doorway looking for Selina, willing to confront seedy people to find her.
Responds calmly and respectfully to Chi-Chi's insult despite being scratched and called 'retard'.
Internal voice shows moral judgment: 'murder is not allowed' indicating personal ethics.
Grabs Chi-Chi and demands help to find the dominatrix responsible for killing a cop.
Responds to Chi-Chi's attack by violently stomping on his knee.
Walks away after the violent confrontation without expressing remorse or further engagement.
Applies fake scar and prepares to confront criminals personally to avenge his father.
Remains silent and non-reactive when confronted by muggers, observing their hostile behavior without engaging.
Responds instantly and decisively to the shove, unleashing a highly effective and brutal counterattack against multiple assailants.
Maintains calm and control after the fight, showing emotional regulation and confidence.
Takes initiative to confront and physically dismantle a group of dangerous attackers, indicating skill and courage.
Grabs dealer's head by the hair and slams it into metal pay-phone without hesitation to assert control.
Walks off after violent confrontation showing confidence and calm despite physical mark (fake scar hanging).
Engages with low-level criminals in a hostile environment but maintains clear personal boundaries, refuses their offers politely.
Puts small bills into the sagging bras of the waitresses/performers, a gesture that can be seen as both flirtatious and transactional, attracting attention.
Keeps a huge roll of money and peels off a fifty to give as a tip to the waitress.
Responds coldly to the transvestite's attempt to cheer him up by saying 'I doubt it.'
Uses violence to defend himself when attacked by thugs.
Uses chemistry sets given by his father to improvise a chemical weapon to defend himself against attackers.
Uses his knowledge of chemistry and available materials to create a makeshift chemical device in a confined space under threat.
Maintains calm and applies intelligence in a high-pressure, dangerous situation despite being physically cornered and attacked.
Stabs the plastic jug with a screwdriver to presumably cause a reaction or explosion, demonstrating practical problem solving.
Attempts to use the plastic jug as a weapon but misses, indicating a failed attack.
Confronts multiple armed thugs alone despite being battered and outnumbered.
Creatively uses a neon beer advertisement to ignite low-lying flammable gas, incapacitating multiple enemies.
After the confrontation, he reflects honestly on his shortcomings and acknowledges his need for further training and advantages.
Despite being wounded and beaten, he maintains composure and completes a ritual task of writing and sending letters.
Accepts the librarian's trust without protest when she lets him borrow many books for free.
Says nothing in response to the librarian's joke and observations, maintaining a serious demeanor.
Pays cash and tells clerk to keep the change.
Enters the chop-shop disguised and commands the thieves to put on handcuffs.
Looks at his father's signet ring and solemnly thanks him, calling himself 'your loving son'
Smiles wide despite missing front teeth after preparing supplies
Examines his father's signet ring closely and picks something out of it with a sewing needle, showing attention to detail and focus.
Smiles wide despite missing all his front teeth, indicating resilience and possibly confidence in adversity.
The Batman lands on Sanchez's desk suddenly, creating fear and confusion among criminals.
Quickly evades gunfire, uses smoke bombs and acrobatic moves to disorient enemies.
Maintains control of the situation until only he and Sanchez remain standing, showing dominance.
The Bat-Man allows Chi-Chi to get shot accidentally during the confrontation.
Uses extreme violence and maiming tactics against opponents, demonstrates ruthless combat style with little mercy.
Mentions that a young attacker will probably walk again but will remain scared, indicating some recognition of their suffering.
Sits bloodied and battered, listening to a confession tape detailing corruption affecting the city, showing his commitment to uncovering the truth and justice.
Remains isolated and silent, reflecting on the pervasive corruption around him without interacting or reaching out to others for support.
Transforms his apartment into a crime fighting command center with detailed investigation materials and gear.
Pushes himself physically to fight corruption despite severe injury and blood loss.
Mentions 'Your loving son, Bruce.' in internal monologue, suggesting a personal connection and underlying sincerity.
Allows Little Al to stay nearby and receive a blood transfusion from him without complaint.
Questions Little Al about not calling the police, showing some concern for consequences.
Assesses his own bandages and attempts to sit up despite pain, showing awareness and self-monitoring.
Relies on Little Al for medical aid and does not call the police despite serious injury, indicating trust but also possible avoidance of official help.
Remains unmoving and patient in the cold rain, using a contact microphone to eavesdrop stealthily.
Shows awareness of being 'invited to a party' indicating he understands he is walking into danger or a challenge but proceeds confidently.
Rescues Selina by instructing her to get in and protects her from gunfire by telling her to keep low and cover her ears.
Uses a primitive taser to incapacitate a security guard without lethal intent.
Engages in violent confrontation by throwing a grenade causing destruction and fires.
Uses a primitive tazer effectively to incapacitate a security guard before an attack.
Commands Selina to get in and follows up with launching a grenade causing chaos and distraction.
Advises Selina to keep low and cover her ears amidst heavy gunfire, demonstrating situational awareness and protective leadership.
Sustains a gunshot wound to the shoulder but continues without hesitation.
Uses his Lincoln Continental aggressively to clear a dangerous roadblock and protect Selina by disabling attackers.
Surprises Selina by handcuffing her despite her expertise, indicating a lack of trust or warmth in interaction.
Quickly releases Selina from the handcuffs after she challenges him.

Uses his Lincoln Continental equipped with advanced defensive and offensive gadgets (road spikes, smoke, oil, tire-puncturing darts) to escape a dangerous situation, skillfully disabling pursuers and protecting Selina.
Carefully plans and executes a high-risk escape maneuver involving crashing into police cars and forcing a roadblock aside, maintaining control and composure throughout.
Pins Selina down to stop her from escaping; insists on not allowing murder even for revenge.
Quickly assumes Selina is responsible for the cop's death before hearing her explanation.
Allows LITTLE AL to lead him through secret tunnels, shows openness and interest in his discovery.
Distractedly reads microfilms, prioritizing work over engaging with others initially.
Reads a paper and quickly uses a home-made photo machine to extract microfilm, indicating technical knowledge and resourcefulness.
Shows a serious reaction to new information by stating 'This changes everything,' evidencing critical thinking and adaptability.
Walks around and absorbs information about the underground chamber and infrastructure, quickly grasping the significance of the asset.
As Batman, observes a mugging but chooses not to intervene immediately.
As Batman, watches a mugging happen but chooses not to intervene immediately.
Despite a seriously bleeding wound in his thigh, he applies duct tape to stop the bleeding, pushes through the pain, and continues to ascend stairs as fast as possible.
Throws himself into burning building to survive, uses stimulant to keep conscious, prioritizes finding shelter over attempting to rescue dying homeless people.
Ambushes and incapacitates multiple armored SWAT team members using surprise and combat skill.
Secures the steel door by kicking it shut and re-clasping the lock to delay pursuers.
Observes the surroundings carefully from a concealed position and uses binoculars to scope out snipers and helicopters.
Carries a detailed underground map on his person, demonstrating thorough preparation.
Plants microfilm in Gordon's jacket pocket undetected, facilitating evidence discovery.
Uses distraction tactics (dropping a brick) to disrupt SWAT team and create chaos.
Drops silently through ceiling hole onto a SWAT member, uses surprising tactics (mace, knife) to incapacitate enemies quickly.
Moves skillfully and with confidence under heavy fire in the lobby, demonstrating physical and tactical competence.
LITTLE AL grabs him before he falls and tends to his wounds despite Bruce's resistance.
Bruce insists he is not done and tries to push himself beyond his limits instead of resting.
Insists he has to keep going despite his injuries, showing determination and focus on his mission.
Refuses to accept his physical limits at first, trying to get up despite being unable to, showing overconfidence or lack of judgment about his condition.
Eventually accepts he needs to rest and heal, demonstrating realistic self-assessment and capacity to recognize when to pause.
Works on a black motorcycle despite being badly injured and in pain, showing perseverance and technical skill.
Stops Loeb by stabbing him in the eye, showing decisiveness and skill in a critical moment.
Steadies Gordon despite own injuries, demonstrating presence of mind and physical resilience.
Tells Ann he is fine despite being visibly very injured, showing confidence and control under pressure.
Refers to a scar on a criminal as 'a gift for a kid I used to know, a long time ago.'
Tosses Gordon his glasses from across the street to help him see better.
Wipes away a tear after signing a letter as 'Your loving son'
Smiles as he heads into his home upon greeting Little Al
